sentences.en: Almost from the outset, the extravaganza was beset with difficulties.
sentences.cn: 几乎从一开始, 这一盛事就被种种困难所困扰.

sentences.en: An ardent outset may be followed by declension.
sentences.cn: 热情的开端可能继之以冷漠.

sentences.en: At the outset of the war there was a great flare of patriotic enthusiasm in Russia.
sentences.cn: 战争刚开始时,俄国人民的爱国热情非常高涨.

sentences.en: At the outset they must contain several ramets of every selected clone.
sentences.cn: 在开始时每个入选无性系必须包括几个无性繁殖后代.

sentences.en: At the outset this set of setting settled the offset problem of the kettle.
sentences.cn: 在开始，这一套设置解决了水壶的弥补问题。

sentences.en: At the outset, it looked like a nice day.
sentences.cn: 开始的时候, 天看上去很晴朗.

sentences.en: Certain problems were apparent from the outset.
sentences.cn: 有些问题从一开始就是显而易见的.

sentences.en: From the outset it was clear that he was guilty.
sentences.cn: 一开始就很清楚:他有罪.

sentences.en: From the outset these researches caused a considerable stir.
sentences.cn: 这些研究从一开始就造成了巨大的轰动.

sentences.en: He was not here at the outset of the experiment.
sentences.cn: 实验开始时他不在这里.

sentences.en: I never understood why he didn't just accede to our demands at the outset.
sentences.cn: 我一直搞不懂他为什么不一开始就同意我们的要求。

sentences.en: I warned you at the outset not to trust him, and you wouldn't listen to me.
sentences.cn: 一开始我就警告过你不要信任他, 可你不肯听我的话.

sentences.en: In the end, the Ten took their appeal to the Supreme Court; this, they had believed from the outset, would be their trump card.
sentences.cn: 最后,10个人上诉到最高法院：他们从一开始就认为这一招是他们的王牌。

sentences.en: It was clear from the outset that there were going to be problems.
sentences.cn: 从一开始就很清楚会有问题出现的。

sentences.en: It’s better to get something in writing right at the outset.
sentences.cn: 最好一开始就有个书面的东西。

sentences.en: The novel fascinates the reader from the outset.
sentences.cn: 这部小说一开头就把读者迷住了.

sentences.en: You should explain this to him at the outset.
sentences.cn: 你应该一开始就向他解释这事.

trans.tran_en: at or from the beginning of an event or process
